summary: The Ground-Based Midcourse Defense system aims to defend the U.S. against ballistic missile attacks from rogue states like North Korea. Since the 1990s, the Department of Defense has largely relied on a prime contractor to manage development of this complex system. It is considering a new approach where multiple prime contractors would develop system components, and DOD, potentially, would integrate them into the larger system...
title: Missile Defense: Observations on Ground-based Midcourse Defense Acquisition Challenges and Potential Contract Strategy Changes
